full_text: @therealhughesie Hi Brian, I suggested four options to improve the scheme, while also keeping the bus route. Two involved segregated cycle lanes on Deansgrange Road and two other options (which should be implemented anyway). There's a lot of misinformation being circulated I'm afraid.

@CoryHendersonG @daveyius Hi Cory, I suggested four options to improve the scheme, while also keeping the bus route. Two involved segregated cycle lanes on Deansgrange Road and two other options (which should be implemented anyway). There's a lot of misinformation being circulated I'm afraid.

@lisa_mcaree Hi Lisa, thanks for your feedback. I support investment in safer cycling infrastructure. Unfortunately there is a lot of misinformation circulating. My recent D√°il remarks outline my views https://t.co/od2d1YPxZe

@finianmurphy @barrymward Any of these 4 options would allow a two-way bus service continue. Bus Connects proposes routes on Deansgrange Road and Abbey Road (high frequency B4), they are important to people living in the area. But I accept that's not a priority for everyone. https://t.co/bYdqu5QqKh

@finianmurphy @barrymward I proposed 4 options: 1 Remove parking on cemetery side to create the segregated lane 2 Engineering changes (which would probably involve a HGV ban) to create a the segregated lane 3 Route per Deansgrange Area Plan 4 Upgrading Link Road / Abbey Road (which should be done anyway)

@CraptainP @smytho @RBoydBarrett I checked this out, I'm told revised guidelines were issued on 19 August 2021 and no one will be excluded from the transplant list, the usual risk/benefit assessments will continue to be carried out if a donor becomes available.

@finianmurphy @barrymward The issue is to be examined at the next DLR Council meeting, I would encourage everyone to have their say and engage with Councillors in advance of the meeting. They can be reached at https://t.co/FhKkDCgTwW

@finianmurphy @barrymward Feedback on the AST was very favorable, but bus users, local schools & residents highlighted issues with the Deansgrange Rd aspect. I proposed a number of changes that would allow the cycle lane go ahead on the route & also other alternatives (which need upgrading anyway)

@finianmurphy @barrymward I welcomed the Active School Travel proposal, held an online public meeting to detail the benefits & get feedback. I called for it to go further highlighting a number of schools that needed safe infrastructure (Castle Park Dalkey, St Kevin's Sallynoggin & others)

@finianmurphy @barrymward Myself & @barrymward have supported projects like the the Sutton to Sandycove #S2S coastal route for years. It is regrettable DLR officials have proposed to remove it from the new County Development Plan. We need to make the coast even more accessible https://t.co/pqvO3GbQtE

@finianmurphy @barrymward Hi Fintan, thanks for your feedback. Its great to see everyone young & old enjoying the coast. I support investment in safer cycling infrastructure. Unfortunately there is a lot of misinformation circulating. My recent D√°il remarks outline my views  https://t.co/od2d1YPxZe

@brendanjoseph_ @TheJohnnieCraig I appreciate people have their priorities and that's to be expected, the Council also have a job to do but many of their plans have been very light on detail about the impact on bus users. In some cases they omitted any reference to certain routes.
@TheJohnnieCraig You are right, apologies. The last reply was on 5th August, the original was issued on Fri 23rd. Cllrs were briefed by email the same night
@brendanjoseph_ Thanks Brendan, I will certainly take a look at DRT options. Hopefully it's something that can be examined at the Climate Action Committee. I appreciate your feedback on the issue.

@TheJohnnieCraig During the Zoom meeting people suggested a number of alternatives options. I included four in my own submission to officials (two alternative routes & two engineering solutions) any of the four would have kept the bus route. But I accept that's not a priority for everyone (2/2)

@TheJohnnieCraig Thanks Johnnie, that's an email I sent on 5th August to update people who attended a Zoom meeting on the issue and asked for updates. It must have been sent on to Brookville/Springhill Residents. I haven't sent any letters to residents. (1/2)
@TheJohnnieCraig Thanks Johnnie, do send it on and I will check (cormac@cormacdevlin.ie). Cllrs were only briefed on 5th August, so that sounds odd

@brendanjoseph_ The proposed L26 and L27 routes critical services for the area, not just Deansgrange Road. Given the significant new development in Cabinteely - Glenamuck I will be pressing for increased frequencies for these routes. Orbital connections are a major issue in DLR
@TheJohnnieCraig @RBoydBarrett @smytho Yes

@TheJohnnieCraig Perhaps you are mistaking me with one of the other reps who sent a letter? I haven't issued any letter to the area. Like most reps I've received hundreds of emails, I've referenced the alternative options I proposed for the segregated cycle route in my replies.

@TheJohnnieCraig @RBoydBarrett @smytho Thanks for the feedback Johnnie, the article is misleading, remarks were omitted and an editorial slant put on the content & headlines. I support sustainable travel options. I have suggested several alternatives that would ensure the area has safe segregated cycle lanes.

@brendanjoseph_ Good access to bus services is critical, particularly if we want to give people alternatives. Bus Connects proposes two-way routes on Deansgrange Road & Abbey Road (high frequency). They should proceed in my view, but I appreciate some people have different priorities. https://t.co/liXwj17bsQ

@brendanjoseph_ Removing a bus route from the area is problematic, particularly given the older profile of the population. I suggested other options (removing parking) to keep the route in place & allow a segregated cycle lane. The issue has become very divisive & misinformation is circulating
@CraptainP Nope, wasn't invited

@daveyius Hi David, thanks for the feedback. I support investment in green infrastructure. I have suggested a number of options to improve safety that go well beyond what was proposed. Unfortunately the article is very misleading.

@brendanjoseph_ Hi Brendan, thanks for the feedback. Removing northbound buses is an issue for bus users in the area. I suggested several alternatives that would allow a safe segregated cycle lane. A HGV transit ban could be an option (I will raise with with FF cllrs).
